title: CPASS-2102 Fix EVM CLI to support parsing slot ID's larger than 64 bits
body:
Fix EVM CLI to support parsing slot ID's larger than 64 bits. 
The oclif flag was parsed as a Number (max 64 bit). Changed it to a string which is parsed to a bigint. This allows EVM slot IDs cast from a 256-bit Solana public key.

title: Add charges to each gatewayToken operation
body:
Charges can now be applied to the following pass operations:

- mint
- unfreeze
- refreshing/ changing token expiration

title: Enforce minimum stake requirements on charge handling
Add delay in fee config updates
body:
- [x] Introduce a 7 day delay to gatekeeper and network fee configuration updates (about 30 lines of code)
- [x] Add test and update existing test

title: Create network fee vault
body:
- [x] Add new method `receiveNetworkFees` that allows for network fee payments in native eth or an ERC20 token (only callable by the ChargeHandler contract)
- [x] Add new method `withdrawNetworkFees` that allows the primary authority of a network to withdraw funds
- [x] Updated The `ChargeHandler` to send network fees on charges if applicable
- [x] Only allow networks to be closed/deleted if there are no fees being stored for that network
- [x] Added test coverage


This change is ~100 lines of solidity. Most of the code changes are test.

title: Update charge handler to read fees from gatekeeper and network state
body:
- [x]  Update the `mint` (issue) and `setExpiration` (refresh) to only require the sender and recipient of the charge.
- [x] Updated the internal `_handleCharge()` method in `GatewayToken.sol` to dynamically read the fee to charge from the state of the gatekeeper and network operating on the pass.
- [x] Added new field to the `Charge` struct used by `ChargeHandler.sol` named `networkFeeBps` 
- [x] Updated existing test that cover charges in native eth and ERC20 fees and meta-transactions
- [x] Added method on `GatewayNetwork.sol` to allow the primaryAuthority of a network to update the fees on the network (a delay will be introduced in a follow up PR)

The next follow-up PR's will be:
- Adding fees to all of the gatewayToken operations: `burn` (expire), `revoke`, `freeze`, `unfreeze`, `verify` will also be done in a follow up PR
- Adding a vault inside of `GatewayNetwork.sol` that network fees are sent to.
- Introducing a delay for updates to gatekeeper and network fees
- Validate a gatekeeper meets the minimum stake requirements during a pass operation

title: Initial gateway protocol staking contract
body:
This PR introduces staking to the gateway protocol using the OpenZeppellin ERC-4626 implementation:

- Link to the ERC standard: https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/standards/tokens/erc-4626/
- Link to the OpenZeppelin implementation we are using: https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/master/contracts/token/ERC20/extensions/ERC4626.sol

The 4 built in methods we care about in this standard are:

### Depositing to vault 
- deposit(...): deposits assets of underlying tokens into the vault and grants ownership of shares to receiver
- mint(...): mints exactly shares vault shares to receiver by depositing assets of underlying tokens

### Withdraw assest from vault
- redeem(...): redeems a specific number of shares from owner and sends assets of underlying token from the vault to receiver
- withdraw(...): burns shares from owner and send exactly the assets token from the vault to receiver


The changes include:

1. A new contract `GatewayStaking.sol` that extends the OpenZepplein ERC-4626 implementation. 
     - This contract disables the `withdraw` and `mint` method so that the only methods that can be used on the vault are `deposit` and `redeem`.
     - Added an admin to the contract that can control the minimum stake requirements
     - Update internal conversion functions so that assets and shares are 1:1. In the case of shares we insure that a user can only claim an asset amount equal to or less than the amount of the shares balance of the `msg.sender`
     - A new ERC-20 token representing a users shares in the GatewayStaking contract

2. The `GatewayNetwork.sol` contract now enforces the global minimum stake requirement when adding gatekeepers.

title: Eth v2 deployments
body: Deployment artifacts for the v2 upgrade of the gateway protocol (post-hacken audit 2)

title: Gateway Ethereum: Post Audit 2 Upgrade
body:
EVM Contract upgrade after the second Hacken audit
[Civic Technologies, Inc._SC Audit Report_31102023_[SA-1963].pdf](https://github.com/identity-com/on-chain-identity-gateway/files/13361221/Civic.Technologies.Inc._SC.Audit.Report_31102023_.SA-1963.pdf)

Major changes:

- Fix security vulnerability when charging ERC-20 SEC-345 HackenProof founding
- Fix issue where an empty-named Gatekeeper network can be taken over by an attacker CIVICSC-4
- Prevent lock-out by the last super-admin removing themselves

Also in this release:

- Minor security fixes as per the hacken audit
- DeployFull script to simplify and reduce failures when deploying to a new chain
- Reduced gas requirements of the forwarder
- Deployment artifacts for new chains

Also add missing return type to parseFlags function.

title: Release/v2 upgrade full
body: Gateway EVM - this PR includes changes to the Gateway Protocol EVM smart contracts following a second audit by Hacken and findings through the HackenProof Bug Bounty.

title: Gateway Eth: SEC-345 charge attack fix
body: This avoids an attack scenario wherein an attacker can take advantage of an over-allocation of ERC20 for a gateway token on a legitimate network, buy creating their own network and issuing a token from there.

title: Update civicnet URL so CLI -c civicnet will work again
body:
The civicnet EC2 box was recreated so the URL has changed.
This update is needed for the gateway CLI to work with civicnet again.
